rComments: The curve is beyond ridiculous, so the class itself was really easy. He, however, was unbearable as a Professor. He's so full of himself that I couldn't stand listening to him, he's rude & condescending, & he was kind of mean as a person. He wouldn't give us a break for a 2 hour class, and then rubbed it in our faces. He takes the joy out of chem.

So easy you can't REALLY call it an Ochem class.  I barely barely barely learned anything and got an A+ because we can use a notecard (as big as a 1/2 sheet of paper!) on each exam (x2 for the final).  Go to class because his tests are made up of the "confirm your knowledge" questions as well as questions from practice exams and the HW.

OMG this guy is funny!! This has to be the easiest Ochem class ever. We get 1 notecard as "cheat sheet" for each midterm, and TWO for the Final. His test questions are recycled mostly from previous years and homework questions and NMR problems.

Very corny jokes, but did a good job keeping the class entertaining (or as entertaining as organic chemistry can be).  NOTECARDS for ALL exams!  I failed the class over the summer, but thanks to getting a notecard, I got an A this time around.

It sounded interesting, but this class is useless. Crews is a bad lecturer and his tests/quizzes were very irrelevant to the lectures or practice tests. The TAs were more knowledgeable. The class is hard, take something else for a GE

HORRIBLE CLASS. DO NOT TAKE. Crews is very inconsiderate and gives tests regarding the most unimportant, random things that no one knows the answers to. He's an unfair grader as well. Find another class to satisfy your GE, NOT THIS ONE
I thought wine chem would be interesting, and i'm sure it is. But avoid this class. Crews is extremely unclear and not helpful.

Crews really cares about his students and does a lot to help them succeed. he gives ec quizzes when you attend class (only gave us 4 though). His exams are not bad at all if you go to class and actually do all the work. Best chemistry teacher I have had so far.

Boring lecturer, goes too fast. Extra credit quizzes make it worth going to lecture, but just read and follow along in the book and take some notes in the margins. Enormous curve and note cards makes this an easier class, but his bad lectures make it a pain to care. He's obnoxious and condescending in lecture, so I tried to tune him out.

If you hate chemistry but still have to take Ochem for whatever reason, take this class. You can do the least work possible and still pass. He gives you extra credit and a notecard for the exam. Did you hear me people? A friggin NOTECARD. His lectures are extremely boring but again, he gives you NOTECARD.

ugh. Don't take 108B with Crews if you can avoid it! Seriously. He is the most annoying professor I've ever had! I could barely make it through class without getting really angry/annoyed at his incomprehensibility. Definitely read the book & do the homework if you want to pass.

Crews can sometimes seem unapproachable but he gives great lectures and is completely fair about the curve and gives extra credit quizzes in class randomly (go to every lecture). His tests are challenging and even if you study real hard you will have a hard time getting an A without the curve, but like I said the curve will save you & you learn alo

Lectures=useless pp slides and unclear. He lets you have a card of notes, a false sense of security. Sure, he puts homework and stuff off the slides on exams, but who can memorize the answers (fit everything on the card)? His grading is SWEET. Yet when the avg is 40%, you have to wonder. ex credit quizzes in lecture make it easier to gulp.Good luck

crews lectures off powerpoints, kinda boring but no matter what GO TO CLASS because of the extra credit quizes that will get you an A in the class. tests are kinda hard, but study the study guide for sure because they help. he gives you a notecard to use on tests it helps.

Even though crews gives extra credit quizes, he divides the total by 2,or else I would have gotten my A. I asked him how far away from an A, and he said 1 point.When i showed him a mistake on the test the TA's did,(enough to gain my A),he came again and said I still was one point away,WTF! useless lectures, practice test similar to exams, hwk helps

Phil is awesome... Very NMR happy, his lectures a little fast and hard to follow ( powerpoint) but overall no complaints. Plus you get a cheat card on the tests, and enough extra credit to make everyone happy.

Crappiest lecturer i have ever encountered.  Only go to lecture for the quizzes that count for your grade.  Better off bringing your book and reading it for 2 hours durin lecture.  Tests were easy. gives you a cheat card.  You will never have to memorize a thing for his tests.  Take his class if you can stand it crappy lectures.

Phil is THE best. I got 20/25 points EC for going to class! section quizzes r basically to see if youre there.  Based on straight percentages I should NOT have gotten an A-! tests r curved heavily.  2nd midterm, a C was 32-50 points out of a 100! he puts at least 3 probs off old exams so study them or copy on notecard!

He gives you extra credit quizzes for coming to lecture.  The section quizzes are freebie points also.  He allows a large notecard for each midterm, and three for the final.  His lectures are somewhat boring, but overall his class is probably the easiest Organic Chemistry course you will ever take.

I dont know what everyone here is complaining about. Phil gave a ****ing notecard for each exam! I dont know any other chemistry teacher that does that. he was the best teacher ive had at UCSC. I got an A+ in his class, although I did put a lot of effort into doing all the homework. but you dont have to memorize anything! thats a godsend for ochem!

Crews is a pretty nice guy, but his tests are extremely difficult unless you are a prodigy.  Even with the notecard and practice exams!  Although the tests are heavily curved so that helps a lot!  Always do ALL the homework and you should at least have a grasp on the subject for the exams.
Crews was an awesome professor. His class was way too easy however because he let everyone bring a notecard to the tests.
very enthusiastic but scary when he wears short shorts

2 midterms. Hw not collected. Extra credit for attending section to take the quizes. Show up to lecture as he had 2 opportunities for extra 10 points towards exam. Clear lecture, powerpoint shows are boring, u can print lectures online. Midterms allow 1 note card for formulas and molecule set and final u get to have all 3 note cards

Although his tests are difficult, this class is not bad at all. He heavily curved the tests, so that students can pass the class. Even getting a score of 57 is considered a B- on the tests. Oh, and he gives  random extra credit quizzes in class. All and all, he's not a bad professor.

His lectures are power point which makes you not want to take notes. instead you sit and become extremely bored. he gives no breaks and class feel very long. he makes cheezy jokes. his test are hard but fair. some liked joe better even tho he was harder but i got an A with phill and only B with Joe
Great professor. Goofy. Genuinely cares about students progress and interest. Goes a little fast over material but managable.

Ochem is probably one of the hardest classes u can take, but prof. crews tries to reward the hard workers. make sure u attend class regularly he tends to give extra credit points during class without notice. Great guy, lectures can be a drag at times. do the homework problems & u should be fine

People people...read your syllabus CREWS!!!.  This class was a little difficult because he tends to speed over things and patronize students with what we should already know.  He also talks like Williams Shatner...a little weird...great guy though
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
